item.description:
FREE viewing of “Argentina’s Economic Collapse: A Warning” a documentary (with English Subtitles) on the events that led to the economic collapse of Argentina in 2001 which wiped out the middle class and raised the poverty level to 57.5%.

Central to the collapse was the implementation of policies which enabled the swindle of billions of dollars by foreign banks and corporations. Many of Argentina's assets and resources were shamefully plundered. Its financial system was even used for money laundering by Citibank, Credit Suisse, and JP Morgan. The net result was massive wealth transfers and the impoverishment of society which culminated in many deaths due to oppression and malnutrition. Official name: Memoria del Saqueo by Fernando Solanas 2003.

Come see if you can spot any similarities to the situation in the United States today – hint: it won’t be hard.

RECOMMENDED READING Modern Survival Manual : Surviving the Economic Collapse by Fernando Ferfal Aguirre
